content.description: The following two-way table shows the responses from a group of people, categorized by age-group, when asked about their favorite types of vacations.
content.question: Nature Adventure Relaxation Sightseeing Total Under 21 50 50 50 50 200 21 to 35 25 35 50 50 160 36 to 50 35 30 50 35 150 51 and over 25 25 50 25 125 Total 135 140 200 160 635 Which of the following statements is not supported by the table?

choices.label: More people chose relaxation than any other vacation type.
Each vacation type was selected by the same number of people in the under-21 age-group.
In the 21 to 35 age-group, nature was chosen by the least number of people.
Of all the vacation types, nature was chosen by the least number of people.
The percentage of people that chose relaxation was equal for each age-group.

content.answer: The percentage of people that chose relaxation was equal for each age-group.

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
